The two images combine a personal, almost whimsical association (the corgi) with a formal, heraldic representation (the coat of arms) of the British Royal Family.
reasoning:

foldername: Eulerian Path(visible, STEM, relation, Non-English European, English)

images.description: A diagram of the Seven Bridges of Königsberg.

The first image represents the historical problem, and the second image shows the general concept of an Eulerian path (or in this specific historical case, demonstrating the lack of a Eulerian cycle).
reasoning:
OriginOf(SevenBridgesProblem, EulerianPath)
ExampleOf(TraversingAllEdgesOnce, EulerianPath)
Thus, SevenBridgesProblem → EulerianPath → TraversingAllEdgesOnce

foldername: Ellipsoid(visible, STEM, mutual elements, USA/English, English)
explanation: Mutual element: Ellipsoid. A rugby ball is a good approximation of a prolate ellipsoid (an ellipsoid longer in one dimension). The Earth, while not a perfect sphere, is closer to an oblate ellipsoid (an ellipsoid wider in two dimensions than the third). While a rugby ball could be just a sporting good, and Earth a planet, presenting them together evokes the mathematical concept of an ellipsoid as a three-dimensional shape.
reasoning:
Approximates(RugbyBall, ProlateEllipsoid) and IsA(ProlateEllipsoid, Ellipsoid)
Approximates(Earth, OblateEllipsoid) and IsA(OblateEllipsoid, Ellipsoid)
Thus, RugbyBall → Ellipsoid and Earth → Ellipsoid
